main event: A dark object with an orange glow was observed on March 14, 1961, around 1920 near Elkine, W.VA.
interesting points: The object was described as being about half the size of an F-86 or P-51,The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes,The object disappeared while still in sight,Initial evaluation indicated it was probably a meteor or fireball,The report concluded that there was insufficient data for further evaluation.
